skill.name: reactome-database
skill.description: Query Reactome REST API for pathway analysis, enrichment, gene-pathway mapping, disease pathways, molecular interactions, expression analysis, for systems biology studies.
skill.summary: Query Reactome REST API for pathway analysis, enrichment, gene-pathway mapping, disease pathways, mo...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Legitimate bioinformatics skill querying Reactome pathway database. Static findings are false positives: markdown backticks misidentified as shell commands, HTTP calls to known scientific API (reactome.org) are standard data retrieval, and documentation references flagged as crypto issues are harmless comments. No malicious patterns confirmed.

content.value_statement: Analyze biological pathways and gene lists using Reactome database. Perform pathway enrichment analysis, map genes to pathways, and explore molecular interactions for systems biology research.
actual_capabilities: Query pathway information by ID (R-HSA-xxxx format)
Perform overrepresentation analysis on gene lists
Search pathways by name or keyword
Get participating molecules in biological pathways
Map genes to human pathways across species
Analyze gene expression data with Reactome API
limitations: Only accesses Reactome database (human and model organism pathways)
Analysis tokens valid for 7 days only
Does not include local data - requires internet connection
No support for custom pathway upload or modification

use_cases.title: Gene set enrichment analysis
use_cases.description: Submit gene lists from RNA-seq or proteomics to identify enriched biological pathways

use_cases.title: Cross-species pathway mapping
use_cases.description: Map mouse or model organism genes to human pathways for comparative analysis

use_cases.title: Pathway exploration
use_cases.description: Query specific pathways to understand molecular mechanisms and disease associations

prompt_templates.title: Basic pathway query
prompt_templates.scenario: Get information about a specific pathway
prompt_templates.prompt: Query the Reactome database for pathway R-HSA-69278 and show me the pathway name, species, and description

prompt_templates.title: Gene enrichment
prompt_templates.scenario: Perform pathway enrichment on gene list
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these genes for pathway enrichment: TP53, BRCA1, EGFR, MYC, CDK1. Show significant pathways with FDR values

prompt_templates.title: Pathway search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search Reactome for pathways related to apoptosis and show me the top 10 results with their pathway IDs

prompt_templates.title: Entity lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: List all participating proteins and molecules in the Cell Cycle pathway (R-HSA-69278)

output_examples.input: Analyze genes for pathway enrichment: TP53, BRCA1, EGFR
output: â€¢ Top pathway: Cell Cycle, Mitotic (R-HSA-69278)

best_practices: Store analysis tokens to retrieve results later without resubmitting genes
Filter results by FDR threshold (default 0.05) to focus on significant pathways
Use projection endpoint for non-human species to map genes to human pathways
anti_patterns: Submitting genes one at a time instead of batch submission
Ignoring the 7-day token validity for result retrieval
Not checking species compatibility when analyzing cross-species data

faq.question: What identifier formats does Reactome accept?
faq.answer: UniProt accessions, gene symbols, Ensembl IDs, EntrezGene IDs, ChEBI for small molecules.

faq.question: How long are analysis tokens valid?
faq.answer: Analysis tokens are valid for 7 days. Store them to retrieve results without resubmission.

faq.question: Can I analyze non-human genes?
faq.answer: Yes, use the projection endpoint to map mouse, rat, or other species to human pathways.

faq.question: What is the output format?
faq.answer: JSON with pathways, p-values, FDR, entity counts, and tokens for browser visualization.

faq.question: Does this skill work offline?
faq.answer: No, this skill requires internet access to query the Reactome REST API.

faq.question: How many pathways are in Reactome?
faq.answer: Reactome contains 2,825+ human pathways with 16,000+ reactions and 11,000+ proteins.
